moves.1. e4 c5 2. d4 g6 3. d5 Bg7 4. Ne2 d6: just another variation, in the Sicilian...
moves.6. Bd2 b5 7. Ng3 Nf6 8. Bc1: White has a sudden change of heart: not sure why...
moves.8... O-O 9. Be2 b4 10. Nb1: this kind of play, will not get White anywhere...
moves.14. Nc4: here is why: loss of tempo...
moves.14... Qb5 15. b3 a4 16. Rb1: a bad decision: probably the losing move...
moves.16... axb3 17. cxb3 Nc7 18. O-O: White still has to finish development: this will cost material...
moves.18... Rxa2 19. e5 Rfa8: very bold: better first dxe5; but Black is on a mission...
moves.20. Bg5: another bad decision: now, Black escapes again...
moves.25. Nb7 Ne6: Blacks' position has cleared up nicely: now we push White further back...
moves.26. Rfd1 Qc6 27. Qxd5 Qxd5 28. Rxd5 Nxg5: the point of no return, for White: he has a safe capture at Rxc5 with the possibility to retaliate to Rc5-c1; or to be totally safe, make air for the King: he chooses greed...
moves.29. Rxg5 Ra2a1: topping it off: mate is inevitable; or losing Rb1: so White resigns...
